info.name: Ranger
info.description: The Ranger class from the Player’s Handbook 2024, modified for Solandria.
info.author: Wizards of the Coast

description.p: Far from bustling cities, amid the trees of trackless forests and across wide plains, Rangers keep their unending watch in the wilderness. Rangers learn to track their quarry as a predator does, moving stealthily through the wilds and hiding themselves in brush and rubble.

Thanks to their connection with nature, Rangers can also cast spells that harness primal powers of the wilderness. A Ranger's talents and magic are honed with deadly focus to protect the world from the ravages of monsters and tyrants.

tr.td: Choose 3: Animal Handling, Athletics, Insight, Investigation, Nature, Perception, Stealth, or Survival
Light and Medium armor and Shields
Choose A or B: (A) Studded Leather Armor, Scimitar, Shortsword, Longbow, 20 Arrows, Quiver, Druidic Focus (sprig of mistletoe), Explorer's Pack, and 7 CP; or (B) 150 GP

ul.li: Gain all the traits in the Core Ranger Traits table.
Gain the Ranger's level 1 features, which are listed in the Ranger Features table.

Gain the following traits from the Core Ranger Traits table: Hit Point Die, proficiency with Martial weapons, proficiency in one skill of your choice from the Ranger's skill list, and training with Light and Medium armor and Shields.
Gain the Ranger's level 1 features, which are listed in the Ranger Features table. See the multiclassing rules in chapter 2 to determine your available spell slots.

description.p: As a Ranger, you gain the following class features when you reach the specified Ranger levels. These features are listed in the Ranger Features table.

setters.set: A Wandering Warrior Imbued with Primal Magic
Light armor, medium armor, shields, martial weapons, one skill from the class's skill list

description.p: Choose any two spells from the list below that you could select as prepared Ranger spells. Those spells are always prepared for you. This number increases when you reach certain levels in this class: three spells at level 9, four spells at level 13, and five spells at level 17. When you use a spell slot to cast any of the chosen spells, you may immediately recover the spell slot (no action required) by expending a number of uses of this ability equal to the spell slot level.

You begin with two uses of this ability and the uses increase when you reach certain levels as shown on the Ranger class chart. You recover any expended uses of this ability and may change your selected spells when you complete a Long Rest.

You choose four Ranger spells from the Favored Enemy spell list for which you have spell slots; these are prepared until you finish a Long Rest. When you cast any of these spells, you can immediately expend a number of Favored Enemy uses to recover the spell slot used. You regain one use of this ability when you finish a Short Rest.

You choose five Ranger spells from the Favored Enemy spell list for which you have spell slots; these are prepared until you finish a Long Rest. When you cast any of these spells, you can immediately expend a number of Favored Enemy uses to recover the spell slot used. You regain one use of this ability when you finish a Short Rest.

description.p: Your Speed increases by 10 feet while you aren’t wearing Heavy armor. You also have a Climb Speed and a Swim Speed equal to your Speed. You have Advantage on the roll whenever you make a Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check to Climb or Swim.
You, and creatures of your choice traveling with you, do not suffer penalties for traveling at a Normal or Fast pace.

sheet.description: You have Advantage on the roll whenever you make a Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check to Climb or Swim. Additionally, you and any creatures of your choice traveling with you, do not suffer penalties for traveling at a Normal or Fast pace.

description.p: Primal forces now help fuel you on your journeys, granting you the following benefits.

Primal Endurance. As a Magic action, you can give yourself and any allies within 10 feet a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to 1d8 plus your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). This increases to 2d8 when you reach level 14 in this class. You can use this action a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.
Decrease Exhaustion. Whenever you finish a Short Rest, your Exhaustion level, if any, decreases by 1, and you regain one expended use of Favored Enemy.

sheet.description: You can give yourself and any allies within 10 feet of you {{tireless:thp:dice}}d8 + {{tireless:thp:wis}} Temporary Hit Points. In addition, whenever you finish a Short Rest, your Exhaustion level decreases by 1.

description.p: You invoke spirits of nature to magically hide yourself. As a Bonus Action, you can give yourself the Invisible condition until the end of your next turn. You may extend your Nature’s Veil for another round by taking a Bonus Action to extend it so long as you have not taken the Attack or Magic actions on that turn, in which case it lasts until the end of your next turn. You can maintain Nature’s Veil for up to 10 minutes.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

sheet.description: You can give yourself the Invisible condition until the end of your next turn. You can extend it until the end of your next turn by taking a Bonus Action on subsequent turns, provided you have not taken the Attack or Magic action during that turn. You can maintain Nature's Veil for up to 10 minutes.

description.p: Taking damage can’t break your Concentration on spells you cast using your Favored Enemy feature.

sheet.description: Taking damage can’t break your Concentration on spells you cast using your Favored Enemy feature.

description.p: You have Advantage on attack rolls against any creature which has taken damage from or failed its saving throw against a spell cast using your Favored Enemy feature. This lasts until the end of your next turn.

sheet.description: You have Advantage on attack rolls against any creature which has taken damage from or failed its saving throw against a spell cast using your Favored Enemy feature. This lasts until the end of your next turn.

description.p: Your connection to the forces of nature grants you Blindsight with a range of 60 feet.
Any spell you cast using your Favored Enemy feature deals one additional damage die. If the spell does not deal damage, any attacks you make while it is active deal an additional 1d8 Force damage.

sheet.description: Any spell you cast using your Favored Enemy feature deals one additional damage die. If the spell does not deal damage, any attacks you make while it is active deal an additional 1d8 Force damage.

description.p: When you hit with an attack roll, you may turn the hit into a Critical Hit. You may turn a hit into a Critical Hit a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

sheet.description: When you hit with an attack roll, you may turn the hit into a Critical Hit.

element.name: Ensnaring Strike
element.supports: Ranger, Damaging Spell, Spell Saving Throw, Ensnaring Strike

description.p: The target takes an extra 1d6 Piercing damage from the attack as grasping vines appear on it, and it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the Restrained condition until the spell ends. At the end of each of its turns, the Restrained target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.
Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 1.

setters.set: Bonus Action, which you take immediately after hitting a creature with a weapon

element.name: Hail of Thorns
element.supports: Ranger, Damaging Spell, Hail of Thorns

description.p: As you hit the creature, this spell creates a rain of thorns that sprouts from your weapon or ammunition. The target of the attack and each creature of your choice within 5 feet of it takes 1d8 Piercing damage and its Speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of your next turn.
Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 1.

setters.set: Bonus Action, which you take immediately after hitting a creature with a Ranged weapon

description.p: You magically mark one creature within range as your quarry. Until the spell ends, you deal an extra 1d6 Force damage to the target whenever you hit it with an attack roll. For the duration, you see the target if they have the Invisible condition as if they were visible. You also have Advantage on any Wisdom (Perception or Survival) or Intelligence (Investigation) checks you make to find it.
If the target drops to 0 Hit Points before this spell ends, you can take a Bonus Action to move the mark to a new creature you can see within range.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. If you cast this spell using a level 3+ spell slot, the spell doesn’t require Concentration, the damage die becomes a 1d8, and the duration becomes 8 hours. If you use a level 5 spell slot, the damage die becomes a d10, and the duration becomes 24 hours.
You move like the wind. Until the spell ends, your movement doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks.

Once before the spell ends, you can give yourself advantage on one weapon attack roll on your turn. That attack deals an extra 1d8 force damage on a hit. Whether you hit or miss, your walking speed increases by 30 feet until the end of that turn. You can use a Bonus Action on subsequent turns to grant yourself advantage on one weapon attack roll on that turn, which deals an extra 1d8 Force damage on a hit, or increase your Speed by 30 feet until the end of that turn.
Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 1.

element.name: Cordon of Arrows
element.supports: Ranger, Damaging Spell, Ritual, Cordon of Arrows

description.p: You touch up to four nonmagical Arrows or Bolts and plant them in the ground in your space. Until the spell ends, the ammunition can’t be physically uprooted, and whenever a creature other than you enters a space within 30 feet of the ammunition for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there, one or two pieces of ammunition (you choose) flies up to strike it. The creature takes 1d8 Piercing damage per piece of ammunition, which is then destroyed. The spell ends when none of the ammunition remains planted in the ground.
When you cast this spell, you can designate any creatures you choose, and the spell ignores them.
Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 2.

As your attack hits or misses the target, the weapon or ammunition you’re using transforms into a lightning bolt. The target takes 4d8 Lightning damage. Each creature within 10 feet of the target takes 2d8 Lightning damage.
The weapon or ammunition then returns to its normal form.
Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage for both effects of the spell increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 3.

setters.set: Bonus Action, which you take immediately after hitting or missing a target with a ranged attack using a weapon

element.name: Guardian of Nature
element.supports: Druid, Ranger, Damaging Spell, Guardian of Nature

description.p: A nature spirit answers your call and transforms you into a powerful guardian. The transformation lasts until the spell ends. You choose one of the following forms to assume: Primal Beast or Great Tree.
Primal Beast. Bestial fur covers your body, your facial features become feral, and you gain the following benefits:

ul.li: You gain darkvision with a range of 120 feet.
You make Strength based attack rolls with advantage.
Your melee weapon attacks deal an extra 1d6 Force damage on a hit.

description.p: Great Tree. Your skin appears barky, leaves sprout from your hair, and you gain the following benefits:

ul.li: You make Constitution saving throws with advantage.
You make Dexterity- and Wisdom-based attack rolls with advantage.
While you are on the ground, the ground within 15 feet of you is Difficult Terrain for your enemies.

description.p: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. When choosing Primal Beast, your walking speed increases by 5 feet and the additional damage you deal increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 4. When choosing Great Tree, the number of Temporary Hit Points you gain and the radius of difficult terrain you create both increase by 5 for each spell slot level above 4.

When you cast the spell and as a Bonus Action until it ends, you can make two attacks with a weapon that fires Arrows or Bolts, such as a Longbow or a Light Crossbow. The spell magically creates the ammunition needed for each attack. Each Arrow or Bolt created by the spell deals damage like a nonmagical piece of ammunition of its kind and disintegrates immediately after it hits or misses.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th or 7th level, the duration is concentration up to 10 minutes. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th or 9th level, the duration is 1 hour and no longer requires concentration.
